title: Brain surgeon Charlie Teo's daughter, 24, banned from driving over car crash
text:
The daughter of renowned brain surgeon Charlie Teo has been slapped with a car ban after she was charged with crashing into the founder of the Comanchero bikie gang, seriously injuring him.

Nicola Annabel Teo, 24 – the doctor's second oldest of four girls – was arrested after she allegedly rammed into William 'Jock' Ross in Sydney's Hawkesbury region on September 25.

Police allege she was driving on the wrong side of the road about 3.30pm when her beige Toyota Landcruiser slammed into the motorcyclist near his home in Lower Macdonald.

Nicola Annabel Teo, 24, daughter of renowned brain surgeon Charlie Teo (pictured together), has been slapped with a car ban after she was charged with crashing into the founder of the Comanchero bikie gang

Police allege she was driving on the wrong side of the road about 3.30pm when her beige Toyota Landcruiser slammed into the motorcyclist near his home in Lower Macdonald

Ms Teo was freed on bail and court documents released to Daily Mail Australia revealed she 'is not to occupy the drivers/riders seat of any motor vehicle' as part of her conditional release.

The bail documents said Ms Teo's charges 'have a possibility of a custodial sentence on conviction'.

Prosecutors believe they have a 'strong prosecution case with both witnesses, physical evidence and CCTV footage of the collision.'

But the documents noted she has no previous criminal history or history of violence.

Police were comfortable with her being bailed after she agreed to the driving ban and a further ban to going within 500m of an airport or place of international departure.

Ms Teo was freed on bail and court documents revealed she 'is not to occupy the drivers/riders seat of any motor vehicle' as part of her conditional release

Bail documents said Ms Teo's charges 'have a possibility of a custodial sentence on conviction'

Ross's injuries were serious, requiring two bouts of lifesaving surgery, including an operation dealing with major trauma to his pelvis.

His daughter, Holly Gittany, told News Corp earlier this month her dad 'remains intubated in a stable condition in Intensive Care at Westmead Hospital.

'Mum, my brother and I are by my bedside.' The family has declined to give an update since.

Ms Teo was in the area for her dog-walking business at the time of the incident, which occurred about 3.30pm.

Comanchero bikie gang founder William 'Jock' Ross was seriously injured in the crash, requiring two bouts of lifesaving surgery, including an operation dealing with major trauma to his pelvis

Ms Teo was charged with dangerous driving occasioning grievous bodily harm, negligent driving occasioning grievous bodily harm, and other less serious crimes

Police said she had a juvenile in the car in the passenger seat at the time of the alleged crash.

Mr Ross was flown to Westmead Hspital and placed in an induced coma due to his injuries.

Ms Teo has been charged with dangerous driving occasioning grievous bodily harm, negligent driving occasioning grievous bodily harm, not keeping left of a dividing lane and not giving particulars to police.

Ms Teo faces Windsor Local Court for the first time on Thursday.
description: Nicola Annabel Teo, 24, is charged with driving causing grievous bodily harm after allegedly crashing into William 'Jock' Ross, giving him serious injuries, in Sydney's Hawkesbury region.
authors: Daniel Piotrowski For Daily Mail Australia
